testcase.name: runScenario["Get all menu items", "Inventory API"](1)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Get all menu items # src/test/resources/features/inventory.feature:6 When I send a GET request to "/api/inventory" # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.i_send_a_get_request_to(java.lang.String) Then the response status code should be 200 # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_status_code_should_be(java.lang.Integer) DEBUG: {"data":[{"id":"1","name":"Classic Muzzarella","image":"classic.png","price":"$8"},{"id":"2","name":"Crispy Bacon","image":"bacon.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"3","name":"Baked Rolls x 8","image":"roll.png","price":"$10"},{"id":"4","name":"Garlic Mix","image":"garlicmix.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"5","name":"Margarita","image":"margarita.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"6","name":"Veggie","image":"veggie.png","price":"$8"},{"id":"7","name":"Super Pepperoni","image":"extrapeperoni.png","price":"$10"},{"id":"8","name":"Evergreen Cream","image":"evergreen.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"9","name":"Muzzarella BBQ","image":"bbqcheese.png","price":"$9"}]} And the response should contain at least 9 items # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_should_contain_at_least_items(java.lang.Integer) DEBUG: {"data":[{"id":"1","name":"Classic Muzzarella","image":"classic.png","price":"$8"},{"id":"2","name":"Crispy Bacon","image":"bacon.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"3","name":"Baked Rolls x 8","image":"roll.png","price":"$10"},{"id":"4","name":"Garlic Mix","image":"garlicmix.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"5","name":"Margarita","image":"margarita.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"6","name":"Veggie","image":"veggie.png","price":"$8"},{"id":"7","name":"Super Pepperoni","image":"extrapeperoni.png","price":"$10"},{"id":"8","name":"Evergreen Cream","image":"evergreen.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"9","name":"Muzzarella BBQ","image":"bbqcheese.png","price":"$9"}]} And each item should have fields "id", "name", "price", "image" # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.each_item_should_have_fields(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Add item for non existent id", "Inventory API"](2)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Add item for non existent id # src/test/resources/features/inventory.feature:17 When I send a POST request to "/api/inventory/add" with body # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.i_send_a_post_request_to_with_body(java.lang.String,io.cucumber.datatable.DataTable) | id | name | image | price | | 10 | Hawaiian | hawaiian.png | $14 | Then the response status code should be 200 # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_status_code_should_be(java.lang.Integer)

testcase.name: runScenario["Add item for existent id", "Inventory API"](3)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Add item for existent id # src/test/resources/features/inventory.feature:23 When I send a POST request to "/api/inventory/add" with body # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.i_send_a_post_request_to_with_body(java.lang.String,io.cucumber.datatable.DataTable) | id | name | image | price | | 10 | Hawaiian | hawaiian.png | $14 | Then the response status code should be 400 # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_status_code_should_be(java.lang.Integer)

testcase.name: runScenario["Try to add item with missing information", "Inventory API"](4)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Try to add item with missing information # src/test/resources/features/inventory.feature:29 When I send a POST request to "/api/inventory/add" with body # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.i_send_a_post_request_to_with_body(java.lang.String,io.cucumber.datatable.DataTable) | name | image | price | | Hawaiian | hawaiian.png | $14 | Then the response status code should be 400 # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_status_code_should_be(java.lang.Integer) And the response should contain the message "Not all requirements are met" # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_should_contain_the_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: runScenario["Validate recent added item is present in the inventory", "Inventory API"](5)
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Validate recent added item is present in the inventory # src/test/resources/features/inventory.feature:36 When I send a GET request to "/api/inventory" # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.i_send_a_get_request_to(java.lang.String) Then the response status code should be 200 # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_status_code_should_be(java.lang.Integer) DEBUG: {"data":[{"id":"1","name":"Classic Muzzarella","image":"classic.png","price":"$8"},{"id":"2","name":"Crispy Bacon","image":"bacon.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"3","name":"Baked Rolls x 8","image":"roll.png","price":"$10"},{"id":"4","name":"Garlic Mix","image":"garlicmix.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"5","name":"Margarita","image":"margarita.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"6","name":"Veggie","image":"veggie.png","price":"$8"},{"id":"7","name":"Super Pepperoni","image":"extrapeperoni.png","price":"$10"},{"id":"8","name":"Evergreen Cream","image":"evergreen.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"9","name":"Muzzarella BBQ","image":"bbqcheese.png","price":"$9"},{"id":"10","name":"Hawaiian","image":"hawaiian.png","price":"$14"}]} And the response should contain an item with id "10", name "Hawaiian", price "$14", and image "hawaiian.png" # com.example.api.InventoryStepDefs.the_response_should_contain_an_item_with_id_name_price_and_image(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
